    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==479124==ABORTING<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id:             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }

          cursor: pointer;

        }

          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Similar with <span class="line"><!---->Similar with <!----></span>issue #1304368<a class="strike-through" <!----></span>this Heap UaF occur when running unit tests.<span class="line"><!---->this Heap UaF occur when running unit tests.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Chromium 105.0.5133.0 <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Chromium 105.0.5133.0 <!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux-chromeOS / Lacros<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux-chromeOS / Lacros<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>(*)Build Lacros with ASAN and pdfium_embeddertests<span class="line"><!---->(*)Build Lacros with ASAN and pdfium_embeddertests<!----></span><br>(*)run pdfium_embeddertests<span class="line"><!---->(*)run pdfium_embeddertests<!----></span><br><br>Will build chromeOS and try it later.<span class="line"><!---->Will build chromeOS and try it later.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>=================================================================<span 0x7fffd23a4bc8<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x60300003efe0 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x60300003efe0 thread T0<!----></span><br>SCARINESS: 51         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         I can confirm pdfium_embeddertest with ASAN/LSAN enabled in a standalone PDFium build is happy with the above fix.<span class="line"><!---->I can confirm pdfium_embeddertest with ASAN/LSAN enabled in a standalone PDFium build is happy with the above fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>this Heap UaF occur when running unit tests.<span class="line"><!---->this Heap UaF occur when running unit tests.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b pdfium_embeddertests<!----></span><br><br>Will build chromeOS and try it later.<span class="line"><!---->Will build chromeOS and try it later.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: autoninja -C out/Asan pdfium_embeddertest<span class="line"><!---->rebuild pdfium_embeddertests target via $ autoninja -C out/Asan pdfium_embeddertest<!----></span><br><br>$ out/Asan/pdfium_embeddertests<span class="line"><!---->$ out/Asan/pdfium_embeddertests<!----></span><br>thus triggers asan.<span class="line"><!---->thus triggers asan.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        In standalone PDFium, I'm using these GN args:<span class="line"><!---->In standalone PDFium, I'm using these GN args:<!----></span><br><br>use_goma = true<span class="line"><!---->use_goma = true<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>pdf_enable_xfa = true<span class="line"><!---->pdf_enable_xfa = true<!----></span><br>pdf_enable_v8 = true<span class="line"><!---->pdf_enable_v8 = true<!----></span><br>pdf_is_standalone = true<span class="line"><!---->pdf_is_standalone = true<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_lsan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_lsan = true<!----></span><br>is_component_build=false<span class="line"><!---->is_component_build=false<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67"><!---->a1da14588a1c61140f869185d956c07da99f0b67<!----></a><br>Author: Anton Bikineev <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Anton Bikineev &lt;<!----></span>bikineev@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bikineev@chromium.org"><!---->bikineev@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 28 17:36:45 2022<!----></span><br><br>cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<span class="line"><!---->cppgc: shared-cage: Fix UaF when lsan is enabled<!----></span><br><br>Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<span class="line"><!---->Before this CL, the caged heap was lazily initialized upon the first<!----></span><br>call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<span class="line"><!---->call of HeapBase ctor. CagedHeap keeps a pointer to PageAllocator which<!----></span><br>was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<span class="line"><!---->was provided from cppgc::Platform through the HeapBase ctor. This was<!----></span><br>not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<span class="line"><!---->not generally safe: the platform is not enforced to be singleton. If it<!----></span><br>happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<span class="line"><!---->happens to die first, then CagedHeap will have a stale pointer. The CL<!----></span><br>fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<span class="line"><!---->fixes it simply by moving caged-heap initialization to<!----></span><br>cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<span class="line"><!---->cppgc::InitializeProcess(), which already requires a constantly living<!----></span><br>PageAllocator.<span class="line"><!---->PageAllocator.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1338030<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1338030" title="Security: heap-use-after-free v8/src/base/bounded-page-allocator.cc:203:27 (Lacros)"><!---->Bug: chromium:1338030<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifb70a2db233ef36a99c919db09bed9ff9f3708ac<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
